newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil thief sees dreams blasted away.
newsitem.headline: Brazil thief sees dreams blasted away.

text.p: A Brazilian man suffered minor injuries when he allegedly tried to blow open a bank safe, but instead blew the roof off the building, a bank official said on Tuesday.
Carlos Eduardo Gomes, 32, was arrested on Sunday after he allegedly tried to open the safe in the town of Jaguapita by filling it with gas and lighting it, the bank spokesman said.
The explosion was so powerful it blew the roof off the building and sent Gomes flying across the room. Gomes, arrested as he tried to flee, denied the charge.
"He said the explosion took place while he was frying a steak in the kitchen," the spokesman said.
